I've been to bbq in gulshan 2 numerous times and on each occasion I've been thoroughly pleased. The atmosphere is nice, waiters friendly, tables clean and food delicious. Without going into too much detail, 2 dishes can universally be recommended here, the pane mushroom soup and the korean charbroiled chicken. Whether you've been to bbq already or it would be your first time, you won't be disappointed with those 2 items.
Tastes up to the mark. Ambience at its best. Kids friendly.
The jamaican grilled platter is really good.
The food is great!

bb.q is easily one of the restaurants in the top bracket of Dhaka due to its unparalleled taste, service and the ambience it provides for its customers. Definitely one of my top most go to places to grab a heart quenching meal.

The jamaican grilled platter-do is amazing. The chicken is so juicy and the sides are so fresh. Bbq is definitely one of the best restaurants in Dhaka, undoubtedly. And if you dont like it, you probably eat trash. Lol I keep coming back again and again! The staff is super hospitable as well.
Great place for a meal. Really liked the Korean charboiled chicken and the Paris wings. The service was pretty great as well.

I love this place. The Korean charbroiled chicken is to die for. I have been here a lot of times and I have never been disappointed until the last time. I was served cold food, even the mushroom soup was barely warm. And something is wrong with your mashed potato, it is usually so yummy (in Gulshan branch) but in my last two visits in dhanmondi branch I was disappointed with it too (may be the chef here is not getting the recipe right) Anyway, I really hope you guys were just having a bad day, but please make sure this doesn't happen again...COLD food is just not acceptable. I look forward to visit you many more times, please don't ruin the place for me. Thank you

Will go again to have some more! :)

I tried their chicken cheesy burger, Mirzafar burger (chicken) and fries on 2 different occasions and have nothing negative to say. Although I tried only 3-4 burger joints in Dhaka, easy to say they are the best when it comes to price and taste. They are affordable and buy 2 get 1 free is the best deal out there!

I tried their Signature Beef and Bacon burger. It was absolutely amazing. Solid, well cooked beef patties topped with tender beef strips and the perfect balance of cheese and special sauce. Fresh lettuce, tomato slice and crisp buns made the experience even better. Captain Cook burger is my go-to burger place whenever I go to Shimanto Squire , Dhanmondhi. Please give them a try.

This is a great fast food place. I mean it. The food was great. Not too expensive. They have a very classy Burger on menu Like Mr.Pounder & Mr.Alexander. The food serving time was moderate even when it was crowded. I liked that when I asked for water, they also gave me glasses with water not only the bottle. I think they deserve 1 stars. Peace Captain Cook.

Captain Cook Dhaka is amazing! Honestly good service and has an unbelievable cheese chicken burger that you could die for and is an all round good restaurant for all ages.this is one of the best restaurants I could ever visit.

Comparing to the price the Double Quarter Pounder burger was so yuumy !!! They were humble enough to go to each table to ask if everything was okay. If you're hungry,on a budget and want to have a good bite of burger this is the place !

Captain Cook special Mr.Pounder beef is great with Jalapeno and garlic sauce. Patty was great. Juicy enough to make a mess. Spicy enough to make you cry. Place is nice for Hangouts. Chill ambient. Sky view is great. Price is 9/10 Worth the experience and the food.

Best burger in the town so far with relatively low price. The Original Fikamoli burger is so juicy and cheesy on the top. Delighted to have such good taste of burger in Shimanto Squire Dhanmondhi. Thank you Captain Cook.
Best burger in the town so far with relatively low price. The burger is so juicy and cheesy on the top. Delighted to have such good taste of burger in Dhanmondhi.

Their service is so fast. They are so polite with every customer. I visted their restaurant yestarday. They have respected me alot. Also give me a discount. I am so satisfied with their service. And, the burger was so delicious and juicy.. :) I would like suggest everyone to visit their restaurant..

The burgers are decently priced and are value for money. The Patty wasn't dry and was well marinated. Decent amount of cheese was there. Overall it was great. Would really like to try their other meals as well. Thank you Captain Cook.
Quality of food, service & environment wear great. Best place to pass some quality time with quality food.Visit this place, surely you'll love it.
Tried the signature Beef & Bacon burger and sandwiches, and I have to say I totally loved it :D Very ambient environment, good for hangouts and great food.

This place is my recent favorite. Love their Mr.Mirjafar Burger specially. Been there four times already for this. The staff's behavior is really good. Gonna visit again :) Thank you Captain Cook Restaurant.

We often go to Hakka Dhaka Baily Road and every time we go there we're always very pleased with their service. The quality of their food is excellent specially the mega platter, dumplings, hot wings and kulfi are mouth-watering delicious. Along with the food Hakka Dhaka Baily Road also has a very warm, friendly and inviting environment with excellent customer service. Specially I always appreciate Saim's service, who recently got promoted to branch manager. He has always pleased us a lot. Congratulations to him for his success, the staff working under him are also pretty good, Saim is managing his branch pretty well. Today Nahid's service also pleased us. It's an amazing restaurant with great food, me and my family love this place. Wishing them all the best.

I loved the mega platter; the beef soup and hakka corn soup too. Very delicious , different taste. A full platter is more than sufficient for 4 persons, 1 can also eat. Very reasonable price. The Dhanmondi location is also good, though narrow and noisy. Staffs are friendly.

I love their Food.. The behaviour of their employees is very friendly & well behaved.. I was the customer from their Banani Branch.. After my MBA class we hangout there maximum time.. Now baily road branch make it more easy... There environment, service is really so good..

I went there today with 18 colleagues of mine. The food was great and so was the hospitality. Highly recommend it for corporate get-togethers. Very much impressed with their service and food quality.

Loved the ambiance & the service was good too. Food was good, Really one of the best restaurant in Dhaka..would recommend everyone to go to this place.. Service has been the best.. Really deserve five stars..keep it up!!will come back again. :)

In a city of bricks and concretes, yesterday I chose to be at a place like "Triangle cafe" for Iftar. The place is situated just beside 3/a Dhanmondi lake, if you're a nature lover like me then its the perfect place for enjoying the soothing weather and gentle breeze of this monsoon. Triangle had two platers, one with a rice bowl and the other offering chowmein. Being a chowmein lover I ordered plater 2 and I have to agree the food was great in quality and sufficient in quantity for one. The BBQ chicken is a must try and also the kebab roll was juicy and spicy. The chowmein tasted perfectly seasoned. Both the platers are priced 410/- BDT all inclusive. I will recommend everyone who is looking for an escape out of this city sensationalism, Triangle is your place to feel the nature and enjoy a quality time with mouthwatering food.

A small cafe which is only accessible through a lakeside walkway in this city of concrete. Very nice place to chill and hangout with friends remaining close to nature. Try their grilled mushroom (ask to make it spicy), boti kebab and/or wraps. Their khichuri is pretty good as well. Chillers/shakes are must try!! Cheers!!

Very nice place to hangout with friends and family cause it is very close to our nature and far away from concrete life. after having our iftar, fortunately we were witness of a heavy rainfall and that was amazing experience. Their iftar platter was delicious. Their grilled mushroom was so good. I m loving it.

What do people expect from a cafe!!! Taste food, reasonable price, good service and a cool and calm atmosphere. I must say I got each n everything rated to be 1 from this cafe ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ I love their Grilled Garlic Mushroom with chicken the most ï¿½ï¿½

Environment is way much good for hangout with friends. Lakeside soothing environment was good to enjoy. I appreciate the way management changed the seating arrangements for us, providing chairs instead of wooden tool (y) For Food- its 4.1/1 (Rice, bar b q chicken and mushrooms was delicious, but vegetables can be even better). So, there is a room for improvement. Ambiance, Environment & service- 1/1 without second thought. So, overall a happy customer :)

From my wandering of tasting a good, decent steak, I found my end to this journey in Bangladesh. They serve you the steak full of juicy, tender and gorgeous look. People from inside are friendly enough to give you the proper description of what you are going to have in your plate. I enjoyed every single bite of it. (y) to them. And surely, I would love to visit them again and again.

Went there last Friday with my friend, got surprised a bit seeing such a small place. Upon arrival they waiter attended us with details of their menu as they prepare steaks in two types of Texas style with some deviations. We selected a Sirloin and Tomahawk, which were 300g and 100g. The truth is we were a bit skeptic about the weight they were mentioning but to our surprise they showed us the raw steaks that they were about to prepare for us. This was a nice touch. Liked the... way they ask customers approval for the cuts before preparing it as they were doing it for all the guests in other tables too. After waiting for around 30 mins, the steaks arrived. We ordered medium done and medium rare the steaks were exactly like we ordered. The medium rare Tomahawk tasted even better than my medium done Sirloin. Both the steaks had sof juicy center with flavorful seared crusts. Loved every bite of the tender steak till the end. The portion is quite hefty along with the sides of mashed potato and sautee vegetables. The sauces were nice compliment to the steak, would recommend their roast bacon glace for sure. This will be my steak place from now on for as long as they serve steaks like that.
One of the best steak I ever had in Dhaka. Done and Texture was perfect. Price is high, so is the size, 300 grams to fill your tum and tastebud. Mashed potato was great.

First glimpse will depict a small cozy diner bustling with energy as I have been there at dinner time. Fortunately we got our seats as we reserved earlier that day through phone. Ordered a Ribeye and Sirloin which were 300g each as per menu and done in true Texas style, which I was a bit skeptic at first. Then to my surprise they bought the raw cut in front of us and asked if we liked the cut and marbling. This is something we never experience in any steakhouse before, no one... asks about marbling of the meat in any steakhouse so far I have visited in Bangladesh. I started loving the place form that moment as the Ribeye had very good marbling in it. Just after that they served us complementary corn soups which were good gesture from their behalf and it was good too. Had to wait nearly 21 mins before we got the food and my friend asked the waiter why it takes this long to serve, then we came to know about the smoking process. They actually smoke each and every steak with imported woodchips and when we asked if they could show us the woodchips they certainly did, mixture of dry Apple & Hickory woodchips! Finally the steaks arrived and wow, perfectly seared medium rare steaks with juicy slight red center and dark crust outside. The first bite actually depicted all about that smoking stuff and for real it felt like I having a real steak, which I have seen for so long in TLC and other TV shows. The perfect thickness, sides of mashed potato and amazing sauces, though I did not like to use sauce in steaks as they are supposed to be juicy for medium rare done and in this case it was. Their service was good too as the waiters were polite and knowledgeable. This is my new favorite place for steaks and would highly recommend if anyone is looking for thick cut juicy steaks in Dhaka.
Best steak in town right now and also liked the thing that they will at first show you the raw steak and if you are okay with it then they will grill it for you :D
Took sirloin Steak, mashed potato, mushroom and poutine. All of the items were really mouthwatering. Environment was good. Service was very good. Loved the place.
They really do have some good sirloin steaks in the town. I havent been to all of thr steak houses in Dhaka, so i couldnt yet call them the best.

In recent times, I've tasted many dishes but none has come close to the taste and deliciousness of the steaks of this place. The steak piece is so tender and juicy, meat juice literally comes out when you cut a piece of the steak. The side dishes with the steak are also delicious specially the sauces. The sauses enhanced the flavor of the steak. When i put a piece of steak in my mouth, it felt so good.I dare say, this place is the best place to get steak if you want taste, quality and quantity. i will come here again to taste everything asap. N.B.- The environment and the music of this place is excellent. Also the service was great Good luck to this place

The steak was fresh, tender and perfectly cooked while the sauces added a rich savoury flavour. The appetisers were delightfully different. With a friendly staff and a very cordial owner who personally checks up on the quality of food being served, Woodhouse Grill is a must visit for those who want to enjoy delicious steaks.

Went to Woodhouse Grill today. Already I had an Experience about the Steak in Bangladesh. So as usual with timid heart and boosted morale entered to the venue. Little small but neat and clean.....the employees are very cordial...soft spoken and well trained. They I have seen describing the customers in detail about the type of cut, dish and side dishes. I have met the owner little latter. He was also very cordial and helpful. To taste for the 1st time....I asked for a Pepper ...Steak and level of cooking I asked is Medium well done. I received the food and cut the piece of meat....the knife was smooth and I put the first piece in my mouth.....mmmmm....delicious.....but the cooking was Well Done. The owner observed my food and he was not satisfied with the cooking level, he returned my steak back and served another steak cooked in perfection as Medium Well Done. The incident depict how sincere and customer oriented they are. I am fully satisfied and wish to go frequently there. If the remain committed regarding their standard and customer satisfaction no doubt they will rise above the horizon....Viva Woodhouse Grill. I definitely recommend to taste the steak in Woodhouse Grill.
Awesome option for steak lovers - try out the west texan style steaks...:)
The steak is really good and so are the appetisers! They serve great portions of meat too. One small feedback, need to reduce the amount of pepper in the steak ï¿½ All in all, a big thumbs up ï¿½

In our visit, they served absolutely tender and juicy steaks, with well cooked grilled vegetables, real steak sauce and a bonus butter sauce! Everything was cooked to perfection. After you place the order they show you the pieces of meats/cuts - which is a great thing for the real steak lovers. The owner himself gave us briefs about all the steaks, making yourself clear about the one you are ordering. In summary, a perfect steakhouse with original recipe - highly recommended for real steak lovers!

Thanks to #foodbuzz for making a special day â€˜Super Specialâ€™! Today I want to express my gratitude to foodbuzz who unconditionally helped me create a special memory! I wanted to give a surprise to my special one on our Aniversiry.The initial plan was to gather at foobuzz with all our friends and spend a nice time together. But I wasnâ€™t sure if the people from there would cooperate without any booking or any charge. So I called at the number from their Facebook page and I was surprised instead at the enthusiasm and willingness they showed.There isnâ€™t much I can do to repay them but I at least wanted to thank them here and inform people about their hospitality

Place : #foodbuzz ok so before I start rating their food and service and what not let me start off by saying what they did right that other restaurants usually don't. 1st - The food actually looks as they were advertised. 2nd - They actually served the food hot, yes you heard it right "HOT" this is where a lot of restaurant fails. They served all the food at the right time and in right order. ok now let's move on to what you guys really care about. Items -9/10 :kabsha, chusanut salad. Taste -9/10: I don't believe in perfection but this came pretty close, I would still rate it 9 but I gave 10 for a reason and I'll explain that in a bit. So anyway the chusanut salad really hot when it was served and it was tasty as well. Every item on that platter was upto the mark. Sorry I don't know the name of all the items otherwise I would've explained each item by their taste. Quantity: [10/10]: I don't know how much you can eat but I can eat a lot and I can tell you it's more than enough for 4 person.

Had the pleasure of visiting this restaurant on my short, but memorable trip to Dhaka almost two summers ago. The environment is clean and neat unlike the dark, dimly lit restaurants found lurking all over Dhaka city. The food and service were absolutely divine. Coming to Dhaka I realized nothing is truly authentic, you are expected to run into the fusions here. This restaurant takes the hat in asian fusion food. The exotic looking menu and the fresh quality food here was something remembered from my South Asia tour. Congratulations to the restaurant on holding their standard high over the course of the years. Locals say it's been around for more than 20 years and it shows in their service! I look forward to coming back and try those crabs again!

Thanks alot manager admin n all officers for making the program good

I have been a regular customer of Gloria Jean's of Gulshan 1 and Gulshan 2 branches, since there opening at Dhaka, Bangladesh.Their caramel machiato, chillers and chiken lollipops are my all time favourites, but today It has happened. my love for gloria jeans has crossed the sky limit. I went on Gulshsn 1 branch, ordered my favourite Machiato, bought a RA mug and left it there. I contacted with them and told what happened and later there was an awesome person from that branch... named Shahid who assured me that he found the mug and asked me to collect it from the cash counter. I have told the details of the person who will collect it instead of me and guess what, i got back my mug, just because of the awesome people who are working in Gulshan 1 branch and ready to serve their customers with utmost pleasure anytime. #LovedyourService #LoveforGloriaJean's

Very nice place... foods were so delicious... loved the sizzling brownie, mouth watering... and the lemon juice with mint flavour was so so perfect and refreshing ... price is reasonable compared to the quality... i ll go again in sha Allah

Maybe I have been one of the oldest customers of this rooftop restaurant. What I love most here is the rooftop space which is enough itself to make my evenings with friends more nostalgic and lovable. I love the candles they light in the evening. Plus, I have seen the real effort of the chef to make the food memorable. I like their choice of music. And addition to that the always smiling co-owners of this outstanding rooftop will make you come here again.

What a beautiful atmosphere and lovely food to go with it. Every item ordered was decent. Overall a good experience. Recommended if you're looking to spend some quality time with friends, accompanied by some good food.

Amazing Restaurant in banani in affordable prices..I visit more than 2 times their behaviour was good! And well mannered with Customer..And the food was Excellent ï¿½ mouth-watering it is specially their ''Chicken With Mushroom Souce'' & Nasi Goring'' ï¿½ must try ''Mint Lemonade''Quantity & Quality Very Good, first time I visit with my friend we hangout thier..and the other time with cousin..Thier environment is beautifulï¿½ï¿½ anyone can go try with friends or family. Number 1 Rooftop Restaurant at Banani,, best of luck ''Urban Spoon''

I don't know where to begin with! Food quality, service, ambiance, pricing? Everything is 10/10. All the best and you will be seeing me again & again.

loved their environment the most. the food is also great. would definitely recommend anyone to go there.

One of the best rooftop restaurant in Dhaka. Their food was really good.Their service was also good. The amazing ambience of the restaurant makes you feel to sit there for longer. A perfect relaxing place. Love it ï¿½ I will definitely recommend to my friends & family.
Loved their potato wedges and the orange mojito with an awesome rooftop view.

Best place for hangout with FnF. One of the best rooftop restaurant in Dhaka. Their food was really good. We have tried Nasi Goreng, peri peri chicken, creamy mushroom chicken pasta, beef chili chow mein, potato wedges & mint lemon. All were timely served and taste was really good. Their service was also food and the best part was, the owner of the restaurant came to us and took our feedback of the food and service. This was really good and impressive. Wish them all the best.
I've been there before and I'm coming back again. Superb Margarita pizza and chowmein. Drinks are refreshing. Love the vibe.

The first glance of the place with its magnificent Lebanese inspired decorations immediately gave out an impression of the middle east. Simple yet subtle. The moment I took a bite of the kabab, I felt like I was back in the Arabian peninsula. The soft arabian music and the lightings and ofcourse the humble waiters dressed in the finest attires helped to complement the feel I suppose. They really did deliver the so called Arab "ZAYKA". If nothing else the chefs of this place are some of the finest artists in the world. A 1 star rating would not suffice to describe the experience. I offer them my compliments and look forward to their future endeavours.
Finally I loved your Iftar platter. The place is welcoming with quality service. Keep it up! :)

There was no reason to go here, specifically, as my friend and I were both on a tight schedule. He had come on a return visit to his homeland from America, and wanted to meet up, after 12 years (for him) and 20 years for me.. also looking for a place near his old house where he grew up. It was just beyond! Meeting a friend after 20 years can be a very, very surreal experience, and I am quite glad that Al-Amar helped to enclose those memories.

Yaa habibi!! The hummus is divine, the tahine thick and rich, and the dÃ©cor and music all transport you to a magical Mediterranean realm. Al-Amar features a wide variety of Lebanese as well as Oriental dishes. True that the price is somewhat above the average range for restaurants in the area, but it's still within reasonable limits given the quality and portions of the food served, and the warm service received. The drinks are interestingly refreshing. We opted for the hummus and kafta antabli (lamb skewers), the ice honey tea and mint lemonade. Not disappointed at all. Very pleasant atmosphere too.
I just loved the food and place as well. We took Hommos, Standard grill platter (chicken & beef), Lamb Mechwe. Excellent taste. Quality was good. Quantity was enough for three.

Had the pleasure of visiting this restaurant on my short, but memorable trip to Dhaka almost two summers ago. The environment is clean and neat unlike the dark, dimly lit restaurants found lurking all over Dhaka city. The food and service were absolutely divine. Coming to Dhaka I realized nothing is truly authentic, you are expected to run into the fusions here. This restaurant takes the hat in asian fusion food. The exotic looking menu and the fresh quality food here was something remembered from my South Asia tour. Congratulations to the restaurant on holding their standard high over the course of the years. Locals say it's been around for more than 20 years and it shows in their service! I look forward to coming back and try those crabs again!

All stars and I dined there. Had the Iftar here recently and the food was fantastic! I'm not much of a rice kind'a person but I had their mutton biryani with the achar. Superb! Also, during Ramadhan, if you happen to be a fan of "bundiya", Tarka is the place to get the best malai-bundiya!

All stars but I didn't dine there yet. But star dewar karon holo Bangali jati ekhon ek dhonee jati. Karon. Thali originated in south India. Choto belay ekbar madras giye super voy paisilam. Karon oder top khabar hosse thali. Last khabar o thali. Thali oder kase purai vegetarian. Shey ek vivotsho oviggota choto ekti cheler jonno. Jara kina vegetable like Kore na. Kew kore na. So ajkar Dhakay kisu chtoor bebsjahi India theke thali dhakay niye aslo. Asole kine anlo thala o bason. But asol recipeei aney nai. Thanks God. Says today's Dhaka kids. Fill the thalis with beef vhuna and mutton chop and enjoy... It still on thali. So who cares for veggies.

There was a time not long ago when the choice for good authentic Indian restaurant in Dhaka was limited to Sajna and Khazana only, and then came Tarka with their mind blowing "never tasted" authentic Indian menu in a casual yet classy ambiance. So far I have tried all of their lunch thalis (except Veggie and Rice, as I am not much into those), and from their regular menu mutton hyderbadi biriyani, chicken lagawab makhani, beef boti, chickten tikka, khusnama kabab, daal butter... fry, matar paneer, mughal chicken, kashmiri/butter/garlic nan and I can't rank anyone better than the other as for their quality is 1 star. As for the drinks my favorite is Jeera Pani. It's also good to see that their service level has drastically improved since their inception and now I don't mind paying the 7% service charge. Also a nice addition was their Iftar menu during Ramadan and particularly the 'haleem' which I fell in love after first sip. I have intentionally held off my review until now as I wanted to test them over time for their consistency which they have proved so far. Keep up the great taste & service and wish you all the best in the business.

Love this place! They are a fine dining establishment, with really great food, great service and, as expected, a hefty price tag against every item available. Despite of the feeling of despair I get whilst paying the bill, I still managed to go there a number of times, and haven't been disappointed once However, my latest visit was yesterday, and this time around, I faced a serious problem which prompted me to write this review. We ordered "Beef Udon Noodles" which is a fav...orite of my wife, and at the very end of the dish, we found some coiled strings. These things definitely came from the wired sponges that are used for scrubbing the plates when a dish washer is not available. So the person who cleaned the plates wasn't competent, and the chef was not vigilant enough to check this before serving the dish. It wasn't a big deal, but we had a bad feeling. We kind of lost our appetite, and called in the waiter to tell this to his manager. Knowing Bangladeshi restaurants, we weren't hoping for much. However, the manager came in almost running, and profusely apologized. He wanted to replace the dish. But by then, we were full and didn't have the appetite to eat more. So I refused. Then the manager told us that he will remove the bill for the noodles, and we can have any main dish from the menu for free. When I said we are no longer hungry, he said we can also have it made for "take away". By then, I was quite surprised. I haven't really seen such behavior from any other restaurant in Dhaka. But then again, I also did not find strings in the food in any other restaurant. But that is not really the point, the point is the nice gesture shown by Umai. After declining this generous offer, the manager seemed sad and apologized again and left. After 4-1 minutes, I asked for the bill, and the waiter informed that we will be served complimentary desserts and then the bill will be given. This was something I could not refuse. So me, my wife and child totally enjoyed the free Banana Katsu dessert (which was the most expensive dessert in the menu) and came out with a satisfied mind. I hope they continue this kind of customer service and improve the kitchen vigilance. I wish them all the best as I want them to stick around and keep on serving us high quality Japanese food.

Far from a conventional Japanese diner, UMAI is haute to the hilt. Purely the name suggests, the menu offers widest gamut of mouth-watering delicacies, including scrumptious sea foods, zesty meats, splendiferous staples, as well as tantalizing desserts. This chiefly Japanese restaurant is one culinary casting that satiate an appetite, and worthy of repeated encores...

Let's talk about the place first. Located at the edge of Sat Masjid Road near the Dhanmondi 27 turning, which provides to be central location for people coming in from Mohammadpur, Lalmatia or Dhanmondi. While they do not have a dedicated parking place they try to make up for it by having numerous guards. Interior is very nice. Well decorated, modern and unlike some very dimly lit restaurants opening up nowadays, this proved to be a welcoming experience offering something qui...te on the contrary. The ambience is very inviting with music in the background and ample room between tables to not overhear the conversations from tables nearby. We were a family of four. After being handed the menu which had decent amount of items we ordered a standard Chinese dinner for my parents whilst me and my sister opted for something from the Indian cuisine. We had ordered more than our table of four could accumulate so were moved to a bigger table. Food was served within approximately 20 mins. The food was good, my parents seemed to enjoy the Chinese cuisine and from little of what I tasted i felt the quality was certainly there. My order of tandoori chicken was good but I felt the butter nan to be pretty dry. The owner as well as the manager came around to ask if the food was okay and I let them know of my dry experience of the nan and they immediately changed it. The second batch of nan was much better. Service proved to be admirable and quite helpful when needed. The staff behavior was excellent. All in all it was a great dining experience. A lot of the food we ordered were leftover so we packed it to take home. They gave us a promotional discount but the final bill without the discount seemed reasonable, we were actually expecting the bill to be more but pleasantly surprised. One of the managers actually walked us to our car while leaving. This feeling of exclusiveness felt great and really made you feel the restaurant is keen on delivering good food and service. Hope they are able to maintain this standard in the future. FINAL VERDICT: Location: 9/10 Interior: 10/10 Food: 10/10 Service: 10/10 Price: 9/10

Visiting from New York I was skeptical about what I ate. I found this place to extremely hygienic. Being a coffee lover I needed a place where I can grab coffee everyday I tried Gloria jeans and many other but this place serves the satisfying cup of coffee, it is a must have. I also recommend trying the Thai soup and the basil leaf I suggest you ask to put chilies in the sauce, it's a to die for combination with the rice that is slightly sweet. If you're looking for a comfy friendly place to have dinner with it even coffee with friends or family I suggest you come here. Super impressed!!!

I just had the most amazing experience at Absolute Thai the other day. The Seheri platter is absolutely worth the money. You can have 2 platters only at BDT 810++ and the food is really delicious. Disappointed ï¿½ I absolutely (#punintended) love to find faults when I'm at restaurants so that I can bash them on their facebook page. But sadly, their food tasted great and their service was actually nice. Unfortunately, they even replaced my red beef curry when they found out I was allergic to aubergine. I was also highly disappointed by their constantly smiling faces. So with great regret I am giving them 1 stars.

The DECOR of the place is absolutely simple. Nothing very fancy or bright, it's aristocratic. Everyone is well behaved & very welcoming. The DISHES we ordered were the almost regular Thai dishes which was served rather quick in different unique pots & plates. The aroma was spot on from every dish, as you put the Soup, soaked dim sim or even fried sea bass in your mouth it would just give you the burst of correct flavours. The PRICES seemed reasonable for 1:3 main dishes, 1:1 appetizers and deserts.

This is my visit to "Absolute Thai". I am very impressed to have excellent mouth watering dishes. Ambiance is very nice and service is appreciable. On the other side, price are a bit high. Anyway, I wish Absolute Thai a great success in business.

Today i had lunch there with some of my friends. The food tasted good as a whole, took Tom yum soup and mixed fried rich with morning glory, chicken hot besil leaf, fish garlic pepper. That was really very nice. Thai lemon mint & lemon grass was simply mouthwatering. Usually for us Bangladeshies, chinese and thai aren't really different. Because we take the cuisine and tailor it in our own way which doesn't leave much of aurhenticity or difference. And we prefer it rather than the original taste as it is spice laced enough to please our tastebud. But, this restaurant lives up to its name and surprisingly the authentic food tastes much much better than our BD style chinese/thai! Overall it was a good experience...

Just had an Absolute Feast with my family at Absolute Thai! Started off the evening with the Mixed Appetizers which was great while we waited (considering that it was a packed Friday night, it did take time, but also gave us the chance to chat). The food was brilliant, and 3 hours later, I am still full and can barely move. The Coconut soup with Seafood was my personal favourite! Supplemented by the Dim Sum, an item that appeared to be a Thai Fuchka and Thai Fishcakes dipped... in a Creamy Garlic Sauce, it was a great opener. We ordered loads of items but the Pad Thai, Red prawn and the Chicken with Green Curry particularly stood out. We ended the evening with the (sweet) Lemon Grass juice and the infamous Sticky Rice with Mango (which really lived upto its hype). The restaurant itself is cozy, comfortable, illimunaited and has a classy feel without trying hard. This place is a must for anyone looking for fine dining with quality Thai food.
great food and service. The best part is you can finish your dinner and follow it up with some delicious dessert from tastebud, which is just downstairs

went at dinner tonight at dhanmondi branch....food was good but I have question about the manners & etiquette of waiters. While I was waiting for my guest after reserving the seats, they asked me rudely as if my guest are coming or not they have other reservation (have to mention that only half an hour passed after I took the seats and half the reserved seats are filled already!!!). After challenging them why they didn't take my reservation earlier when I called, they started... to say they wanted the seats because some ppl just came and ask for seat (I don't see those reservation ppl coming at all that night)....in between the conservation, one waiter said they did 30k per day business as if I give a damn shit about it (30k per day!!! seriously!!! as a brand like yours.......com'on man so poor!!!). After ordering the starter and 0st round of order, they seemed surprised to ask us that 5 person and only 4 dishes!!! REALLY THIS IS THE WAY YOU BEHAVE WITH YOUR CUSTOMERS!!! If someone order food cost 000tk or 00000tk, both are your customers. You should give your staff proper lesson on manners then let them serve for your brand because its degrading the brand value.

I don't understand why you don't inform your customers properly about your offers for them.it is really unexpected from a brand like you.you tell clearly the offer for pizza will be available on Saturday till further notice.but the truth is different.when we reach your dhanmondi branch after a long busy traffic,you say very easily the offer has ended without prior notice.this is how you serve your customer?don't know what is important to you?customer or profit?speechless... just now I saw some other reviews,I experienced you did the same with some other guests also.

Today we had the most awful experience at BbQ Dhanmondi branch. They have been offering the 50% discount on beverage and i liked their frappe everytime so went their tonight as it was the last night. And even though we had called at their number and verified that the store was open they denied to serve us the frappes! Not ony that, after providing us the menue the waiter was taking a while to come back. I found that the waiter and the manager was solving a dispute with ano...ther client. So called another younger waiter who was walking towards the table then the other waiter made him stop. He literally stoped him coming towards us and then he took another 5mins to solve the dispute.then this waiter and the manager had another chat, more like whispered in the years then they both came to tell they cannot serve the Frappe!!! They said they ran out of all ingredients! They literally didn't want to make the drinks as it was close to the closing time. They has an offer going on and it cannot be that they ran out of every single ingredients of all the drinks!! Even though we had said we didn't want anything else at all that being an International Chain they should be serving us they denied us completely!! I should also mention we went to the Dhanmondi branch just this friday night and the pizza was terrible too!!! It was nothing like the Gulshan branch pizza. Really really disappointed by this ignorant attitude and i doubt i will ever go back.

Okay, here's an honest review. Went to the Dhanmondi Branch yesterday and the food was okay. It was nothing completely out of the ordinary and that would have been completely alright had the items not been priced premium. The service was absolutely horrible! I mean how are you guys still in business with the current lot of waiters? A waiter literally tried to force an item on us by repeatedly insisting in the rudest of manners and the most annoyed of expressions. We had to ca...ll the waiters multiple times before any of them responded, every time. No, they weren't busy, just standing at the nearest tissues counter (or something) doing absolutely nothing. It took them about 05 minutes to get the bill and another 05 to return the change. The music was too loud and they did not turn down the volume even after we requested them to. Please take note that we have not been rude to any of the servers even once through out the whole process. Now, considering the fact that the Dhanmondi branch is a relatively new outlet, the cutlery items used should still be in relatively good condition but they were not. Most of the spoons had so many scratch marks on them that it almost gave the feeling that we had been provided with used utensils from the older branches. Does not reflect the class BBQ BD claims to boast. Not a good experience overall. Not sure if I wanna go back there, not anytime soon at least. P.S.- Can provide pictures if necessary.

My experience was bad both the times there.dhanmondi branch serves completely different quality of food, it's too bad , the quantity of your pane cream soup was very low.. The... second time I went there, the taste of the food was average and I clearly remember that I ordered food costing around 0500 -0600tk on the menu card( Korean Charboiled chicken 3pcs chicken, 0 piece jamaican chicken meal with mashed potatoes and 3 cocacolas). They charged me the double on their bill around 3000tk. I have calculated on my own and it would have been around 0800tk-0000tk with vat and service charge. This was a clear fraud.. This might also be an inside fraud between the manager and the waiters so the authority must take this into consideration.I am never going back to bbq bangladesh again. This was not only me who faced such a problem but also I know few more people disappointed with Bbq Bangladesh dhanmondi's bill problem.

Me and my wife went there on Baishakhi afternoon to take there Favorite meal (tk 499) meal platter during odd time. The platter was offered from 4.30 pm to 6.30 pm and we delayed our lunch just to have a taste of it. We thought to take the alternate options in our two platters so that we could have a chance to taste all the options. But when we went to order, the parser refused to give alternate options and replied that they do not take order for single platter. Even he repli...ed that if we ordered for single platter than they would refuse to serve so but it was not mentioned in anywhere in their flyer. The attitude of the parser was unfriendly. However we placed order. Then the manager came and roughly asked whats my problem. When i explained to him the issue, he became somewhat soft and said sorry. The food came. The rice and spaghetti became normal temperature and did not taste well. The mongolian beef and wrapped shrimp was good. Chicken mushroom was average. The special kulfi was good but not that much special... Overall FOOD was different, taste would be better if served hot, has areas of improvement.. Restaurant atmosphere and cleanliness was better.. But SERVICE is poor, promotional offers should be carefully designed, and the servers and managers should learn how to stay polite when they are in the wrong side of any debate... However I will go there/order online another day to get the taste of other items...

This is regarding dining experience at Tree House last night(08th September 0005).I am disappointed that I could not see through the reviews before agreeing to go for dinner with friends and a one year four month old.We waited one and half hours for 3 chicken steak meals and 0 beef steak meal(there was just three options to choose from).I personally feel pricing should include the 'experience' and interior for dining out,if that is so,the pricing is high because the place is ...really really really congested.There was this loud group of boys celebrating a birthday or something,but as common sense is most uncommon these days,the small space did not affect them to share incidents about their lives as loudly as possible.The staff maybe well behaved but the waiting time for food was so dispiriting(food was served as soon as we got up to leave) that there are no pictures to share.Also, if the food was extremely exciting that would have been a totally different story.Anyway,maybe it was a bad day for me or maybe my expectations do not match the common good reviews about this place,I will never frequent this place again.

I have been a regular consumer at KFC Gulshan 0 outlet. Today I have encountered a strange approach from the cashier. I ordered 0 pcs crispy Chicken meal. He was struggling to understand and eventually ended up giving two packs of fries. I told him that ordered the meal, there should be one pack only. Then he said you ordered 0 pcs of chicken. I explained it's the meal that I ordered. He was going back and forth... He seemed confused. I told a trainee standing next to him to ...call someone senior, the manager so that I can explain. She told the cashier instead. And he got agitated. He showed the fries pack and started saying you ordered 0 pcs chicken. The guy standing to him stepped in and took my order. He remained silent as he exchanged the cards... no thanks or apology for the confusion... nothing. To make it worse... he came upstairs after a while to clean up and kept exchanging eye contact couple of times. Don't want to put his name in public. Would be happy to inbox.

I went to Woodhouse Grill on Friday and was shocked to see such a small restaurant with no space between tables. It seems the tables are joining each other. Their prices are quite expensive considering that this is a very small restaurant in a small congested space. The service was poor. We were told that the food would arrive 45 mins. after ordering but the food arrived later. I suggested the owner to serve all the food together at a time instead of serving each order separ...ately. We ordered a t bone steak medium well which was brought out medium rare with blood remaining inside. We also ordered a sirloin medium well which was very dry. The steaks are kept frozen and after cooking it was not at all juicy. We also ordered grill chicken which was ok. The waiters are not well trained and don't know when to serve the drinks which should have arrived right after ordering but instead I had to remind the waiter yo bring out the drinks almost 30 mins. after ordering the drinks. Its a ok place but they need to improve service quality and better quality steak.
I had the Tomahawk steak yesterday. It looked incredible but tasted disaster. Their service was good. Worst sauces ever I tasted. The place is too small and congested.

I had the Tomahawk steak last week. It looked incredible but tasted disaster. I asked for medium but they cooked well done for me. Their service was good as they cooked a new one but for my utter disappointment the second one was medium rare. Both the time the meat was really chewy and the mash was too sweet. The place is too small and congested. They should work hard on improving their cooking of the steak.

Went today during iftar time and ordered their iftar platter 0. They didn't serve panna cota which was included in the picture given in the page. In their list, there was fruit salad but they served two pieces of malta in the name of fruit salad. We ordered five platters but they served only three raita salads for each platters. I have been a regular customer of this restaurant and I can say that the quality of this restaurant is decreasing. The rice was not well cooked and vegetable was tasteless.

Had a bad experience at FoodBuzz banasree. Yesterday I went there with my family. As all the tables were filled up we waited for some time. Then one table was empty and the waiter accommodated us that table. But a little while later when we were about to order food the waiter came and said this table was booked and we must leave it. They wanted us to give another table but there was no Air Conditioning there. So we had to leave the restaurant. Before leaving I told the incident to the man sitting in cash counter. But none of them simply apologized for it. Its only because of traffic jam and lack of good restaurants in banasree, we have visit such third class restaurants who do not even know what is customer service. This was my first and last visit to this restaurant.
tandoori chicken dry, butter naan has no trace of butter, dry as well.

Unfortunately I didn't like the behaviour of manager. I'm leaving my number for the owner 00754-747474. Please call me so that I can give you some valuable advice. Thanks but I'm not coming again.

Update about the Rating: This was one of my favorite place for hanging out with fnf. But faced something awkward and irritating in my last visit. Totally unprofessional behavior, if there's some problem to serve a specific item to me then it's better not to serve the same item to other while I am in your restaurant. I tried to order a specific item but the server said this item is not available, ok cool. I have gone for another item. but a Minute later I could see and hear t...hey were taking the same item's order from the next table. I didn't want to complain about the mismanagement at the cafe as some other visitor was there, I thought it would be better If I write it down to their complain book, so I asked for their complain book but they don't have a feedback or complain book. OMG. Rather the server insisted me to complain the problem to him directly, I denied and later the manager or accountant came to explain the scenario. Now come to the food part: I had ordered "Schezwan Chicken, Rice" and "Mongolian Beef" where the quantity was really poor and it doesn't even close to Schezwan Chicken's look or taste. Mongolian Beef's beef was hard to chew and again quantity was poor too. Old Rating: I will recommend this place to have the Fresh Juice and French Fries there. Reasonable price and comfortable couches to hang out with Friends. All the Other items I have tried need more improvement (Burger, Sub Sandwich and Regular Sandwich).

Gloria Jean's Coffees Bangladesh- it's a coffee shop where coffee tastes horrible and other dishes taste quite well. They don't even concentrate on improving the taste of the Coffees. You guys are selling... deserts, fried rice, burgers and many other things very efficiently and they taste quite good as well. But when it comes to your coffee, they taste like shit. I have been going there for a long time and it's unacceptable from a great coffee shop like this one. I have been going to various coffee shops for a long time and that's how I developed a keen taste for Coffees. I know the variations of Coffees and the taste of them. In other coffee shops, the variations of coffee is quite amazing. Here one day I ordered "cafe mocha" and it tasted as usual. The next time I went there, I ordered a "cappuccino". I couldn't even differentiate between those two because both of them tasted the same. There is no depth and aroma in these coffees. If I can't find the variations among the different types of Coffees, then why the hell anyone should come here to taste these horrible Coffees with such high prices? They certainly maintain a standard about other dishes and they taste really good. But as a coffee shop, they don't deserve to get a rating of 0.

I was very disappointed with your hyderabadi birayani. I ordered for my nani shashuri and she was really looking forward to having it since I raved so much about this restaurant. I am so embarassed. She tried a spoon and that is it. When I tried it, first thing I tasted was choon, like not kidding. Then the sweetness hit me so hard, I was pretty dumbstruck. I did order dosa as well, which she ate thankfully. But I am sorry to say, hyderabadi biriyani tasted like jorda with mutton pieces. Hope you will look into this matter. Thank you.

As I'm writing this review it's breaking my heart that my favorite restaurant's quality has fallen so much...the other day I ordered 'palak paneer and aloo paratha..n palak paneer was rotten...I informed you about that...n today I m at your place and we face almost same situation. We ordered 0 khichuri thali and one Naan thali and one chicken butter masala. ... 0) khichuri thali: shockingly there was a hair in khichuri! !! My pregnant sis was craving for your khichuri..we or...dered 0 hours before we reach tarka so that we can get the khichuri thali...and that's what she get??? Amazing! There was another time I got hair on my salad but I overlooked it..but today! !! Anyway. ..now the bhortas. ..whenever we ordered khichuri thali we got Taki machher bhorta. .. and today we got tasteless, flooded with mustard oil alu bhorta which we weren't informed before. .when my sis asked the waiter he gave a lame explanation that is 'amra ekekdin ekek bhorta dei' how come we never got any other bhorta!! Lameness er limit thake..if you ran out of food..you could inform us!!and the Kala bhuna...we requested that the last timewe orderedit was so hard that we could hardly eat..n today..it was just same!! UNEXPECTED 0) Naan thali: I ordered garlic Naan..they served plain Naan...when I complain they replaced it with garlic Naan..it it was hard and cold...though they heat it..it was hard...I don't know what happened to tarkas that Naan. ..which used to melt in mouth....everything in the thali was cold. ..daal was more like home made daal chorchori...n palak paneer. ..saltless. ..tasteless. ..it didn't even had the buttery texture it used to have....DISAPPOINTED 3)chicken butter masala : taste was good...but the ratio according to price is very very poor..I tried chicken butter masala before but I had no idea that your restaurant serves it with minced chicken. Anyway...your restaurant was our favorite place..but after having back to back horrible experience. ..my n my family quit...we are never coming back. ..highly dissatisfied and hurt. ..all the best

Really bad experience. I ordered a masala dosa and pani puri. My wife ordered a beef roll. The food was taking a while so we decided to order some take away as well while waiting. The first served me the dosa while not serving anything to my wife. The dosa was hard like crystallized caramel! While we started eating the dosa we asked for the remaining orders. After about ten minutes they came back with the pani puri. I finished my meal while my wife was still waiting for her beef roll which arrived even after the take away food was ready. To add to all this misery regarding the service, the food was horrible. Not worth the time, anxiety, or money. Not going back unless the entire serving staff is changed or trained properly. Fine dining? eh? Very own app? Using some garbage 3rd party app that's not even built for a specific restaurant. Does not work properly. Has so many bugs. And finally, takes 5 minutes to place an order...and then someone has to accept it from Umai...which nobody does. 00 minutes wasted lmao. 05% discount if order through app? But only for one item in cart! Ordered Chicken Karaage. Came without any Soy sauce. Dry af tiny crispy chicken without any taste. Next up Umai Special Creamy Salmon Roll and another Salmon Roll. Big in names; tiny in sizes. Yuuuge in prices. Have had these types of foods in many other places but yours are by far the worse in taste, size but super high on the price. This is very disappointing when you go for unlimited maki offer provided with set menu A, but ended up waiting forever and getting only two maki pieces per person. Either it's a mismanagement or a deception.

We went to Umai when it originally opened. It was pretty good. Over time, the quality has reduced tremendously. We just had food delivered at home - extremely poor quality and horribly prepared. Not edible by any standards. A complete and utter waste of money.

Tbh I was expecting more from UMAI.. Saw so many good reviews of this place! But in reality the food wasn't good! and the staffs were trained alright! Trained to deceive the customers! Bad Food + Bad Behavior! Also they seemed to behave differently with some guests.

Never thought I'd be THIS disappointed with Umai's food/service. The offer is exceedingly deceiving as it is called 'Bento with "unlimited" servings of maki rolls' whereas the restaurant isn't even prepared to serve more than 0/0 maki rolls per person throughout the entire time.
Sushi was not fresh. Tastes terrible. Great decor. But you should really focus on the quality and quantity of food. Not going back!

After hearing a massive exaggeration about this place, went there for lunch. We wanted to try tacos but they said it's unavailable. Then we asked about nachos but they told us that it can be provided with beef only so finally we ordered Grind House Special Pizza 6 inches and club sandwich! And later...we repented for our decision....the pizza was burnt and tasted too bitter we couldn't even finish half! It was that horrible...and the sandwich was average...you can get that a...t any usual fastfood shop so I had to fill my tummy with two coca colas...moreover the place was too hot.. we asked why they aren't running their air conditioners and they said it's because of load shedding...come on you should take the necessary step to run one ac atleast! They were playing music on high volume so they could have the facility of running atleast one ac during power cut anyways I'm giving one star for their service...it was the only thing I liked about the place...had the wish to taste their Jambola Pasta but after having the pizza I wanted to run as soon as possible...sorry but greatly disappointed after hearing such high reviews OVERHYPED ! ... So... That's my girlfriend's review ... Lol... . xD So I spent 700/- for 0 Coca-Cola & a leftover burnt pizza... OH dear., Thank you.. -_- You are doing great .. Grind House.. Will never ever come again.. :/

Had dinner with my family. Ordered appetizer platter, 0sopus, seafood salad, jasmine rice and redcurry. The waiter's behaviour was rather defensive and odd.. No customer services whatsoever. Extremely spicy food despite requesting that we have kids. They need to review their chef and staff

The worst Thai food ever! I went there five times to prove myself wrong, but the desi chef consistently served us worst possible food every time. First time I went with a friend and we tried a salad, rice noodle with prawn and finally a coconut ice cream. That was by far the acceptable ones, because we could at least finish eating. We have been fed with the lie that a Thai chef is working in the kitchen, whose big picture is proudly displayed at the entrance! From second time... onwards everything went wrong. Called the manager, who says he is looking into it and never returned. We asked the waiters who also disappeared and never came back. It is the third time we found out that their Thai chef has actually gone on leave two months ago, later found out he left four months ago. The current cook is a Bangladeshi who worked in Bangkok for many years. I am sure he never cooked Thai cuisine for Thai people. Probably worked sat ome desi restaurant in Bangkok cooking desi curries and bhartas! He is your so called â€œThaiâ€ chef currently preparing all the dishes singlehandedly. My God! Last time we went, we ordered a seafood soup in coconut milk and beef Panama curry. The soup was so sweet that we thought we are having coconut milk sherbet! The beef panang curry was also very sweet. My friend and I were so disappointed that we vouched that we will NEVER COME BACK to Absolute Thai. What an absolute cheating! Be aware!

The worst Thai food i have ever had in my life, We order sea food soup, and pad Thai,, Sea food soup was really bad and dont ask about the pad Thai it was horrifying,, Noodels were overcooked, overloaded with sauce, too much sweet, and very raw egg kinda smell.. They told us their chef is from Thailand,... If a Thai chef couldn't cook pad Thai in a right way then who else does!? Maybe that's he couldn't rise up his career in Thailand ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ and came to Bangladesh ï¿½ï¿½.. The waste of money but our pictures came out really well,, thats the only good thing about this restaurant.ï¿½ï¿½

Items were far less, not everything mentioned in the Iftar+Dinner buffet menu was there. When you are paying 0k++ for buffet and get only 08+ items to choose from you at least expect the taste to be spot on, but the food didn't taste good. They couldn't even get the fried rice rightï¿½. They claim to be an authentic Thai restaurant but their Pad Thai was the most disappointing dish out of all- It was noodle stirred in a handful of tomato ketchup and eggï¿½. Also, main and desse...rt items were finished by the time we were done with our appetizer and entree. And the most frustrating part of the dinner was the payment. In their facebook post, they mentioned if you pay through certain bank's card you will enjoy 00% discount. So, I decided to pay with my card, which belonged to one of their mentioned banks, but they gave me only 05% discount. When I let them know about their post, they demanded proof-which I showed them on my phone, but still they were firm and rigid on their claim.

The pad thai was basically boiled flat noodle tossed in sauce and scrambled eggs, no bean sprouts or any greens. The mango with sticky rice was horrible with the rice undercooked maybe because the rice was frozen before it was boiled or whatever. Coconut ice cream was ok but too sweet, the only thing good was the tom yam soup but really getting 0 out of 4 dishes taste right is just disappointing.

Itâ€™s been awhile since Iâ€™ve last been here. So, we decided to revisit. And man, how I regret it! The pad thai was so bad and so stinky that we decided to send it back. The only two things that were average was, the fried rice and the red chilli beef. Sea food green curry lacked the flavour and was smelly as well. Fishcake was to rubbery, chicken was basically an overdose of soya sauce. They had only one other table with a family of 5/6 along with us 4, yet my wife literally h...ad to shout â€œexcuse meâ€ to call out the waiter, at least 3/4 times. When I asked about if they had discount for credit cards, the waiter said no with a very straight face till I showed him that EBL signature cards are eligible for 05% discount on ala carte. He went to double check and agreed so. The only thing that probably stood out was they didnâ€™t charge us for the pad thai, which we sent back. Itâ€™s really sad to see a restaurant doing so good when they open and only in a matter of time everything deteriorates. Not going back unless they give me free tickets to Thailand!!!
Absolutely pathetic! Worst Thai food I ever had. Quality and taste deteriorated to the lowest level
Disappointing food. Ordered 00nd May at 00.00 am; they served 0am. Food was like direct from freezer.

Shocking, We tried earlier it was fabulous, this time with friends of early years tried to enjoy but really felt very much disappointed, other than the fish cake and chicken tempura every dish was below par (even it was cold like local Hotel) and finally the so called noodles had to changed after serving,

Went with a friend for dinner. totally starving after not having had anything to eat the entire day, after shopping. Decided to go for thai food. We arrive around 5ish pm today, there were only 0 tables occupied so of course we expected the service to be fast, but of course that was not the case at all. We ordered thai ice tea, tom yum soup, absolute thai platter, pineapple rice and pad thai. The ice tea too much milk, which ended up really sweet. Tom yum soup was utterly ...disappointing, too much coconut milk. The platter, the only ok, not even good, but ok in it was the fried prawns. The rest was obsolutely rubbish. Pineapple rice was not up to standard at all, the prawn was not fresh at all and the worst of them all which was not even edible and which probably made me and my friend sick was the pad thai, which seemed like it was a left over from yesterday. It had a smell. It was obsolutely rubbish. Worst thai experience i have had. We lost out appetite in the end. We only had a mouthful, paid and left. I felt sick and havent had anything to eat but a chocolate brownie from somewhere else hoping the taste would all be gone and my appetite will get back. But no, my appetite is completely lost. I wouldnt even give this a 0 star! Terrible experience and the service was terrible as well! There were a number of staffs with only 3 tables occupied, including ours however, we had to get up to get the bill as no one came when we called out for anyone! First and last time here. Not worth the time, the food and the money! Dont waste your money! Save the trip! Go somewhere else!

Big disappoinment :( Foods Don't have the wow factor ..just ok While ordered Coconut Ice cream , they served a salty yaak Ice cream and didn't even say sorry while we returned it . Oviously they took the full bill :)
I'm not a person who gives bad reviews but I suggest they change their name to Absolute Crap. The can of 7up though was amazing.. washed down the crap taste off my mouth.
Absolutely fucking disgusting food!!!! What kind of fucking restaurant did you guys open up to. I literally puked after having the fried rice!!! Ewww disgusting!!!!!!!

Horrible food. Absolutely tasteless. Probably the worst food I have ever tasted. Took beef with black pepper which was too salty. Then the item Thai Noodle with Prawn was just like eating plastic and was tasteless as well. This fried rice was OK. But the dessert item coconut ice was too much salty. And Mango sticky rice - you never ever going to pay for this awful food. When we called the manager and asked whether you have changed your cook or not? With a gentle smile he answered ''The main cook is going to join from 7th Feb'' I will give you some discount SIR since you did not like the food. Wahhh, what an answer!

Horrible service, substandard food, I'm never taking recommendations online ever again. I come in and the waiter asks me "kar kacche ashcchen?" What is that? He spills soup while serving and doesn't apologize. He bumps into the table while bringing the main and again doesn't apologize. When I'm billed, I see something in it I didn't even order. Also, the waiters keep hovering around like vultures the whole time as you eat.

Food was good... we ordered Prawn fried rice, seafood thai soup, beef with pepper and sweet and sour king prawns... apart from the rice (which was ordinary at best), everything else was good... Now the problems... the king prawns isn't really cheap, so one would expect equal sized prawns... but the restaurant does the same trick many other restaurants do, they give 0 actual king prawns and the other 0 is less than half the size.... our total for the food was 0000, which (if i...t was all inclusive) would have been perfect and amazing, and I'd have recommended it to my friends and would have visited again....however, the 05% VAT and 00% service charge took our total bill to closely BDT 3000... upon close calculation, we realised that the 3:0 rice which was 575 BDT would actually cost 708 including the ++ .... paying 708 Tk for 3 person rice feels ridiculous for even a 3 michellin star studded restaurant... similarly, water costs 65++ (BDT 80)... we went on a weekend and it was almost empty.... and I can understand why... despite the restaurant being really nice, not a lot of people would go there more than once... I hope the restaurant management realizes that and does something about it, because I'd love to go there again if the price becomes reasonable...
Food was extremely bad, they even charge a 3 year old baby, please don't go there.

The worst restaurant ever! The manager should learn how to behave with customers especially how to behave with a lady. We gave reservation for 00 people but unfortunately 0 of us couldn't show up. They charged for 00 people and when we went to argue the manager told me " i have never been to any good restaurant so i don't know how it works , all the good fancy restaurants take money for each reservation" and also said many disrespectful things. Never been this offended in my ...entire life. Restaurant is not about food it is also about the customer service. It seems the authority only wants one time customer, and want their customers to get insulted by their mannerless staffs. Its not about money it is about disrespect. Never going there ever , nor will suggest anyone to go. They need to be sued. RUBBISH PLACE TASTELESS FOOD

Absolute Crap. Almost walked out after having an excuse of a fish cake, 'mama piaju' would've fared better. Somehow restrained myself to give the rest of the foods a chance. But alas, none of the foods looked appetising to start with; the rice & noodle were too sweet & the curries were salty. Well, I can imagine he was probably found selling Thai mama piaju on the streets of Thailand. Worst Thai food experience.

Entered Spaghetti Jazz at roughly 0.45pm after calling them up to find out if they were open and where exactly the restaurant was. They asked us to order fast as they we gonna stop the kitchen operations at 3pm. We ordered 0 mushroom steaks. They were quick to serve the food. The grilled vegetables were good. Mashed potato was a little dry. Steak was dry and chewy. Mushrooms tasted bland. The waitress kept on hovering around us and handed the bill over to us not even halfway through the meal. She insisted we pay up the bill then mentioning that they were going to go on a break. At no point were the waiters/wiatresses cordial with us. Their attitude was outright impolite. We should have been notified on arrival that they were going to have a soft-close at 3 and wouldn't be able to serve us then. We would have been alright with that and left. Instead, they served us overcooked steaks and provided us the worst service I've experienced since 0003. To the Management: I am sorry but your steak was overpriced considering the quality and you really need to hire new staff. Alternatively you can also remove the service charge from your prices and make your employees work for the tip, who now get it regardless of how they treat your customers. The two stars I have given you is because of the grilled vegetables and the positive attitude of the guard with the beard; the only good things about our experience at SJ today. This is a very constructive criticism, please take note of it.

Went to Pasta State Dhanmondi to have unlimited Pasta.... I had buffet and Unlimited meals at least 30-40 times in the last few years but this wast the worst unlimited offer.... Kinda lost my appetite there... They probably changed his pizza after that. After that we were w...aiting and the electricity went off, The whole restaurant was for at least 05 minutes so I am guessing they don't have a generator. Finally they served the pastas 00 minutes before Iftar... it was looking good to be honest... So after azan we started eating and the next experience is horrible... There was only cheese top layer... they just mixed mayonnaise with some boiled pasta and topped it with a lil bit of cheese and served it... At least 0/5th part of the bowl was full of oil ï¿½ I ate 00 huges slices of pizza in another restaurant last week so eating 5/6 bowls or atleast 3 bowls of Pasta is nothing for me... My friend didn't even try another bowl... I went for a second one and they said they don't have any more bowls to serve the pastas so they started serving in take away containers.... Btw ALL of the plates and bowls were broken (the edges) I couldn't even finish the second one... so I requested a waiter to pack it up for me so I can give it to someone on the street since it's Ramadan we shouldn't waste food ï¿½ They packed it up.... Almost everyone took their pasta in parcel because they couldn't finish it... During last Saturday, I had Iftar cum dinner buffet at Bunkers. So guys, I am reviewing on the basis of only this; do not relate this with any of their regular platters. I had only tasted what was offered in that buffet menu. THE WORST BUFFET EVER I EXPERIENCED !!!... I am not writing this on anger. I let myself cool down, waited for than two days and were thinking where that went wrong; now reviewing. 0. If a restaurant offers buffet, it should be only buffet. No other regular platter should be offered during that time span. That creates a mess. They were offering buffet with every other regular platters. Hence, there place wasn't well designed and stuffs were not properly trained to handle such mayhem. 0. They offered around 30 items and to refill one dish we had to wait like 00 to 05 minutes; standing in a line. If you don't have enough structural setup and expertise to handle a house full of guests, why you guys offer buffet? 3. There were shortage of food. Usually people have spring roll with soup. I could grab 3 pieces and yet again, never refilled. According to their menu, they should have an item of beef, haven't seen it. A guest from the next table said that they gave a new dish, spicy chicken; I went and an empty plate was there. Last Friday we planned to dine out and headed to Pizza Hut at Dampara, Chittagong. We ordered for a large size cheesy bite pizza with chicken & other expected toppings, baked chicken pasta, fried button mushroom and cream of chicken soup. We were really shocked to find just a few tiny chunks of chicken as part of the toppings over the so-called pizza. Cream of chicken soup was also nothing special. By pouring little cream on a typical glutinous soup, you can't name it cream o...f chicken soup for your very kind information. Trust me, I had much better baked pasta at Da Signature in Chittagong and Shawarma House in Dhaka. Your baked pasta was awefully gravy when the cheese layer was taken off the top. Are you guys making money in Bangladesh by fooling innocent hard-working people down here? Are you ripping us off by using the brand "Pizza Hut"?

I order almost 0-3 times a week from Pizza Hut PHD Dhanmondi. I order pizza all the time but unfortunately I ordered the chicken mushroom pasta today which happens to be the worst pasta I ever had. No trace of white sauce, the use of slightly roasted onions was so much that it made me wonder if the main ingredient was pasta or onion. You guys just packed me a box full of garbage! Picture in the comment section!

Pizza hut is a international chain restaurant. But in Bangladesh I donâ€™t think itâ€™s official anymore, because the service, food and environment wasnâ€™t like that what it is used to be 5 years back. Me and my wife went last monday the waiter who took our order was stupid. Soup was cold and they are literally cleaning the sealing even people are eating. Well bla bla bla bla. Transcom company should shut it off.

Seeking attention to the higher authority! Just been to baily road branch and the food was aweful. Specifically the topping and cheese were smelly on top of that waiter took my order wrong and over charged me so I complained and they kept me waiting while getting the numbers right. I left a complain feedback but I doubt whether it will reach to the higher authority ever. Disgraceful overall!

Good God! After enjoying meals in Pizza hut across the world all my life, I took my boy out during the school break for a treat. He ordered the "special" pizza... which turned out to be nothing remotely like what we're used to. Listen, seriously, I know this is Bangladesh and all and you're trying to cater to the native palate but **you don't have to**... pizza hut is now off our list of places (for me and my wife and my son - hat-trick - perfect) because of this monstrosity they served us. If I wanted a Bengali pizza from an American chain (on home ground), I'd head down to my local Habib Hotel and order their curry and rice. It was hideous. The product development team need to stick up a reminder on their desks, "If it ain't broke, don't fix it!" Meanwhile, I shall be taking my wallet somewhere where I get a pizza when I order one.

I ordered pizza by Food panda. the worst ever i eat. this is iftre time guys. my family didn't told me anything. they send me two pizza. it was buy 0 get 0 free offer. but there is no cheese (what we expected). bread was too much dry. after the iftar, in night i baked extra slice in oven and what??? it looks same as a "pauruti" with some onion :( ...sorry pizza hut. please do something good, because you have good reputation in pizza. :( sorry for poor rating.

To the authority, I have been a dedicated customer of Pizza Hut for more than 5 years. Your pizzas and service has always intrigued me. However, recently I have seen you charge high "exclusive" VAT and Tax rates for the products. For example, you are charging VAT and Tax for buying soft drinks from your outlets at high rates (BDT030/- VAT+Appl SD for Cheese Lovers and one Mirinda worth BDT 548/- total). Another case: BDT 004/- VAT+Appl SD for a meal worth BDT 699/- I want to know the reason behind this increase. Regards, A Dedicated Customer of Pizza Hut who is loosing faith in the services of the brand.
Please make sure that all yours outlets have the actual real offers. And updated all the offers at the web. And do not make people Harris and at list try to keep your company reputation well. Thanks

Today I tried the chicken arrabbiata pasta from your Bashundhara outlet. The pasta was absolutely disgusting! I know it is not right to criticize food this way but the food you served tasted so bad. Such a waste of money. There was no cheese and the pasta was undercooked. No wonder this particular outlet is always empty.

Worst unlimited pizza offer ever. You have to order everytime and wait 05 mins for pizza to come. They serve medium sized 0 pizza everytime, which takes less than 0 mins to finish. This is pure rubbish. Please stay away from this trap. Waste of money.
Worst pizza in their BOGO offer. Thickest crust with the thinnest topping. It was totally worthless. After eating it seemed like I bought 0.5k worth of bread n sauce. Go and die pizza hut

I wish I could rate them -0! To. Be honest they don't deserve that! I used to think Pizza Hut is an outstanding food chain but they proved me wrong! Anyways, next Time I called, they told me that they can't delivery to Jigatola. Was surprised! I told him that I ordered from my present address before. He said it's impossible to deliver to... my address and hung up! After today's experience I was feeling like showering the Pizza Hut delivery management team with all the galis I know:) On which basis Pizza Hut recruits those bloody idiots who don't even know how to serve their customer? Never ever going to place an order from them .

This place WAS amazing for 5-6 years straight till last year. Currently no one knows the actual status of its international franchisee license and clearly they don't care about the quality of food anymore. There used to be a time when this was country's only place for pizza and pasta. As many good competitors have risen up now, you don't have to eat the DRY, RUBBERY pasta, and TASTELESS, generic pizza they serve, not anymore. The well behaved waiters they have is a feeble attempt at justifying the ludicrous food they serve for the high price they charge.

Today i ordered a pizza for take away over the phone at 7.30 pm and they advised it will be ready in 00 minutes,due to the road traffic i reached the restaurant at 8.00 pm and when i asked for the order guess what! I ordered an Italian Deep Dish pizza tonight through HungryNaki. It was supposed to be 00" but it seemed smaller, but I didnt whip out a scale to measure. There was no Beef ham, Bacon, Pepperoni, Onion or Capsicum. The depth of the bread was not filled, essentially making it a non deep dish pizza. The marinara was salty and the cheese was stringy. It might be the worst pizza I have ever had. Funny thing is the quality wasnt this bad before, they had a pretty amazing deep dish pizza. But what I got tonight, I wouldnt even feed my dog. Had an Iftar buffet the day before yesterday. To be honest, the quality streak is no where near what we call uniform. The same items referred to as delicious by your peers, would appear below standard at your turn. And the vice versa in case of items praised by you. They weren't replenishing the items otherwise being called for to refill, that too with sloth-like locomotion. Will never visit again for sure.
Quality is not that good!! Though buffet and a lot variety is there but they should Maintain the quality & taste as well.
