I was there with friends and each time my friends wanted to order something, the waiter countered asking them to order someone else. Our experience was pretty bad. They seemed new. Most of the foods in their menu were unavailable. They even gave excuses like "our fridges were down, so we can't prepare the milkshakes". The staffs took order from us 5 times as anything we ordered was unavailable, as they went on asking the chefs I think. Finally we managed to order something. Then they kept us waiting for too long time. They even forgot half of our order. Also we ordered wrapped swarma and they claimed we ordered arabian swarma. This type of hazardous experience we had. Quality and quantity does not meet up to the pricing. Food is very much over priced. Moreover place is cozy and uncomfortable. They were not professional at all. I'd not recommend this place.

Recently we went there, cool ambiance with good food under reasonable price. Nice Welcome Drink and Chatni with the food. We had ordered several items but mostly we liked the Chicken Chaap and Brain fry. The Beef Chaap was good but it was over cooked and the Seekh Kabab needs to improve lot more. Over all we are happy and like to come again!

The service was really bad. The waiters were rude. Apparently the platters are limited, so we could only order platter 0. They served with missing ingredients. After calling them a million times, they came and added the missing ingredients. Also, the platter says 3 dates but they provided only 0. Not that it matters, but at least don't mention the quantity if you can't deliver. The vegetable and the Dory fish batter had hair. We were so pissed off and there was no time to change, so we just didn't bother to let them know or anything. The food was mediocre. Nothing exceptional. The service and the hair made the experience worse. Highly disappointed. We are paying for good service and good food. The least they can do is not serve unhygienic food and be nice to us.

though the ambience of the restaurant and the taste of the food was more or less good, but the quatity of food is horribly less according to the price. we were around 4 people and we ordered a mixed seafood platter worth around 500 tk.. each platter almost contained 4/5 pieces of mushroom, 3/4 pieces of small calamari, 0 pieces of shrimp, nd e few pieces of chicken. the platter was hardly even enough for one person. you should look into the matter.

Sad. Ordered Creamy Dory but gave us another dish bcos they don't have time as they have a big order to handle lol. Had to wait 40mins for food. Service was poor. Interior is great. Food was average.

We went at around 0 pm, and a little later the waiter told us the food would be around 00 minutes late. This was supposed to be brunch, so we asked them to serve us some food which would come fast, while we waited for the rest. They told us the prawn dim sum would be served in 5 minutes, but it came 00 minutes later. After an hour and half, around 0:30pm, we still hadn't been served anything else! We told the manager that we'll only take any food which they could serve by 0:30, but they failed to serve us our orders even by then. We paid for the dim sums and left ravenously hungry, with no apologies from the manager. Apparently there was some owner's brunch which caused this unacceptable delay! Worst service ever.

I love Chow's dumplings but the price I pay for includes food n service both. We went for a friend's birthday last month n ordered the lamb from the main course (as I had it before n I liked it). I put a piece in my mouth and found the lamb totally cold. My friend thought that the dish has to be served cold but as I mentioned that I had it before. So, I called the waiter n told him about it. He took away the dish right then and came back with explanation - "the chef went out ...of the kitchen so the other person in charge prepared the dish and he forgot that he didn't warm it." We are paying this price to have refrigerated food??? The manager came to say sorry n served us complementary brownie but how can it replace the fact that they serve cold food from the refrigerator. I have never seen the management write a reply to any of the reviewer so I wonder, does it really make any difference to them?
horrible....price wasn't justified with the quantity of food..so was the taste ï¿½...and really dissappointed.

I was impressed by the decor but was disappointed soon by the food. Food is overpriced and bland. The quantity of each item was very small compared to its high price.I had better dumplings in Dhaka. The chowmein was chewy, leathery and cold. I didn't find any Cantonese flavour in any dish. Even the iced tea was very bitter. The service was very slow and poor. I didn't expect such poor service and bad food from a high-end restaurant like Chows.

A complete disappointment, most of the food we ordered was left uneaten as it tasted stale and unappetizing , the prawns we ordered tasted mushy and had a funky flavor, as did their whole fried fish and fried rice, not at all what you'd expect from a premium establishment. Do not recommend and definitely won't be coming back.

Was extremely disappointed with the service yesterday. We went there for brunch and waited for nearly 0.5 hours and yet the food was not served. Whenever we inquired about the order, they kept insisting that the food would be out in 00-05 minutes. Eventually we got up and left. The staff needs to be given a training on customer service (try getting a crash course from the staff at Izumi)!

I made a reservation for four at 0:30 pm yesterday. I was there on time, however, my friends had reached a few minutes prior to 3:00 pm. Before they could make themselves comfortable, a waiter insisted that we order at once, since apparently their kitchen closes at 3:00 pm. We did, and waited for 40 minutes (which they asked from us) for our food. Immediately after we finished, our waiter had gotten us the bill before we even asked, and said that they were to have a staff pa...rty- an implication that we leave. The food was good, but not out of the world. Therefore, from such a high-end restaurant, service at-least is well desired from a customer's end. Provided the place would be overcrowded (or even close to being crowded) on the occasion of Pohela Boishakh, I would have understood. I'm afraid that many other reviews well portray how they tend to serve their customers.

We availed the buffet iftar,dinner. But the iftar was set menu and dinner had only 5 items including rice & chowmein moreover the taste was average. I don't know about their regular menu but the buffet was not good.

Serious lack of cordiality comparing to the other places I have visited within last few days.. If u want to have good Chinese food find an alternative restaurant.. Interior is beautiful and a dimsum probably named prawn chicken Sui mai tastes good, the ginger drink was good but such a small amount was given
nothing special.... so so... we went two times but food was not that tasty according to the price...and recent days food served cold in many restaurants, don't know why??

I had to wait for almost 0 hour 40 mins for dinner today. While we were leaving without having food, the owner lady stopped us and took care of the rest. This is not how a well known dining works. They must work on time.
Just horrible. Never coming back here again. ï¿½
Ambience and service was good but food was overpriced considering the taste and quantity! Really disappointed!

The food was below average and the service was absolutely horrible.

Their iftaar is too much expensive and the quantity is very much disappointing. I don't know why they have chosen the Ramadan for their plunderage and we are encouraging them by taking the part of that dishonesty !
They are most arrogant in attitude... everyone should stop going there until thet beg pardon openly......

Food is honestly good, but i only rate 0 stars because your credit card line wasn't working!!! A restaurant if this stature and prices should expect to have redundancies for credit card/debit card processing facilities.
Very poor Service .... This restaurant dnt know how to deal with their customer ... People who have enough time and prefer to eat cold food thn this is the right restaurant for them..

Waited an hour and a half for cold food and the waiter was very rude. There were 3 kids with us and he claimed our order was "poor" for 9 people. We asked repeatedly for the manager who never came. No discounts or apologies. The table opposite us was so furious with the service they yelled and did not touch their food and left. 5 of us said we would never come back.
Horrible service. The server forgot to bring two of our ordered items not once but twice! I was very disappointed.

we went to Chow following much hype regarding the food and so forth. Unfortunately turns out as following (0) waiters are very poorly trained regarding assistance during placing order and also hearing out on table preference. (0) food is not of much good/better taste then of recently opened other similar restaurants (3) Waiter's advice on the portions were HORRIBLE Highly discourage visits to Chow not only for the service but also for the taste of food.

Going through your Facebook page, nowhere does it say that you have to make prior reservations. My husband and I went to Chows on Friday night, and we were literally turned out because we had no reservations! I see from one of your reviews that another customer had the same complaint. This level of customer service is unacceptable! As a regular food connoisseur, I'd suggest that you teach your staff customer relations because no amount of glitz and glamour will get you loyal customers if your restaurant has abominable customer service!!!

I made a reservation at Chows and went their with my foreign guests. Went I called them to reserve a table they told me that the last order was at 3pm however they will consider my foreign guests and still serve us lunch after hours. When I went there with my guests they literally shut the door on our face and refused us to enter the restaurant. They should have never accepted our reservation if they were unable to serve. They don't have basic human decency. I even told them ...that my Chinese guests would just like to look around even if they cant serve us lunch. Still they shut the door on our faces. How can they be so rude to customers when they will have no business without us. I sincerely advice them to learn how to operate a restaurant and teach their staff basic manners. There are number of Chinese restaurants in Dhaka so don't think that your restaurant is any special.
Food was tasty, but they cheated with price & discount :(

The people of Tokyo Express have turned to thievery these days. It was bad enough that the service has gone to hell and that the food portions have decreased in size, they have also turned to stealing your food. Went there today with the family and there was a lot of food left over so we asked them to pack it for us. Got home and saw that all the left over sushi was not there. They didn't pack it. Packed everything else but the sushi. Really disgusting to think that they either ate it or they were going to serve it to the next customer. Really appalling Tokyo Express.

Worst sehri-outing experience I had till date. Yesterday afternoon, I called up the baily road branch and reserved seats for nine people. The staff member who talked to me had confirmed and assured me that the reservation was placed. At 0:05 AM when we actually arrived at the restaurant, we got to know that this reservation was never communicated to the sehri shift staff member. Kudos to them for their great professionalism :) But this was only the start. They served us the first plate at 3:07 AM, a mere 00 minutes before the sehri deadline. We waited for more than an hour thinking that okay they didn't communicate the reservation among themselves but surely a franchise like Sbarro will be able to serve up some platters in 30- 40 minutes. We were dead wrong. Even after taking such a long time, they didn't serve the full platter. Barely half of the offerings were plated in front of us. Sadly, all these things weren't the most pathetic part of the experience. This sham of a restaurant they are running didn't even have spoons! Yes, a restaurant without spoons. We had rush-eat rice with a fork and a knife. With 00minutes till the sehri deadline.

Worst sehri-outing experience I had till date. Yesterday afternoon, I called up the baily road branch and reserved seats for nine people. The staff member who talked to me had confirmed and assured me that the reservation was placed. At 0:05 AM when we actually arrived at the restaurant, we got to know that this reservation was never communicated to the sehri shift staff member. Kudos to them for their great professionalism :) But this was only the start. They served us the first plate at 3:07 AM, a mere 00 minutes before the sehri deadline. We waited for more than an hour thinking that okay they didn't communicate the reservation among themselves but surely a franchise like Sbarro will be able to serve up some platters in 30- 40 minutes. We were dead wrong. Even after taking such a long time, they didn't serve the full platter. Barely half of the offerings were plated in front of us. Sadly, all these things weren't the most pathetic part of the experience. This sham of a restaurant they are running didn't even have spoons! Yes, a restaurant without spoons. We had rush-eat rice with a fork and a knife. With 00minutes till the sehri deadline.

poor service During unlimited pizza offer , Had to wait approximately 30 minutes for a pizza slice ,very disappointing .

[I did not have Sbarro's food so my review is based on their service only] Earlier today I messaged Sbarro asking if they took any reservations, and they replied saying that they did not in fact take any reservations and that it's on first come first serve basis. Which seemed fine to me. When I went there later on today, it was jam packed with people as expected but what surprised me was when the guard asked me if I had a reserved table or not. And then one of the waiters as...ked me the same thing as well. Lots of people were still going inside because they had reserved their seats and I just stood there surprised that they denied taking reservations earlier today and lo and behold they actually did take reservations. In the end me and my siblings had to dine elsewhere. This kind of confusing service is extremely disappointing, especially coming from Sbarro which is widely lauded to have amazing service. And this was our first time there too. My question is this, if you did take reservations then why deny that fact to a potential customer?

The Blissful BBQ Bash of m cafe costing 300 TK. The presentation of the food was good but they can improve it,well the taste of the food was not up to the mark.The rice tastes good but the quantity of it needs to be increased,the salad that they gave I think it should be sliced more thickly then it would have been better. On the other hand the BBQ ckicken was perfect, according to me it was perfectly cooked, in each an every bite the juicy flavoured of the chicken could be felt ,the BBQ sauce was a perfect combination with it.So over all it was not up to the mark of the pricing stratagy,the pricing should be around 030-050 TK. I know that a cafe have some overhead costs but still charging 300 TK on it, makes the food expensive comparing to the taste and quantity.

I have always been a big fan of North End, but had a terrible experience today. Well, the coffee was very good as usual but the desperate effort of the staffs to close at 00 pm felt a bit weird and extremely uncomfortable. I went to North End at Cityscape tower with my Wife and Brother in law at around 00:30 pm. By that time they have already rounded up all the chairs and tables, which itself is not right if the official closing time is 00 pm. We ordered 4 cappuccino and were... waiting for our Sister to arrive.When she arrived at 00:00 pm they had already closed the sliding door. One of the staffs stopped her outside when she said my coffee has been ordered and they are waiting inside, which can be seen through the glass. The staffs kept arguing with her and given that the sliding door has already been turned off she got hurt hitting the glass door. This is sad as you feel unwelcome in a reputed coffee boutique. I personally feel this is what happens when you leave everything on the staffs. Quite a bad experience!

So I have been a customer of Pizza Inn since it started in Dhaka with their own building in Gulshan,Dhaka. I really liked eating pizza here. But what yesterday happened what just really disappointing. Look people make mistakes. I know that. I saw mistakes in Pizzas since day one. But you people improved. Then you reached the top of pizza chain (atleast to me). But yesterday's service just dragged you down to the last. So like any other day, I went with my family to eat ...pizza around 7 p.m. I sat at my usual place in second floor. Then there was this offer going on where you buy 0 large pizza and get another one absolutely free. So i ordered this BBQ Chicken classic pizza with the another one Pizza Inn Special which costed more. So obviously they took the second one as my order and the first one as the free one. It took them about 00 mins which is usual. They first gave the pizza inn special pizza. No fork or knives were in the table. They never offered one too. Then after I asked, they gave them. The waiter also had lack of knowledge about service (It was not his fault btw because he wasn't trained well. And i even tipped him well because he was really young) Then there came my usual and most favourite flavour BBQ. But it was really disappointing when i tasted the second one (BBQ). It tasted exactly like the first was. It was extremely disappointing to eat two pizzas with the same flavour even i ordered two different ones. I asked the waiter about that but he said he didn't know. I hope you review you your mistakes because I myself never expected this kind of service. My family also got disappointed which made me feel sad because I was the one to force them to eat here whilst they wanted to eat elsewhere....

A story of disappointment and deception -_- Poorest food, price and service I have ever experienced! I am totally shocked at your response to the queries of the customers. It took about 40 minutes to deliver pizzas. Almost all the items are overpriced. The pasta I ordered was not worth 475 taka at all. Also, it was almost chilled, didn't look like you cooked it after I ordered. The waiter was always confused to our questions. You put the different columns for pizzas and crusts, well fine. But why there were no thin crusts which we ordered? Your worthless waiter was insisting us to order the high priced ones! That's how the pizza wich was shown taka 660 or something turned into 990 taka! Cunning policy, indeed. Totally disappointed at your work. Never coming again.

First of all they are not worthy enough to give even one star but since this is the minimum rating, I am giving one. Their delivery is very time consuming and on top of that they more or less forced us to take their stuffed crust which is of BDT 095. They have thin crush which they don't charge extra money for but that was not available. So it clearly proves that they are taking extra money for their so called stuffed crust forcefully! Now a days customers are willing to spend extra money on good food so you don't have to steal it from us showing lame excuses. If that is your business strategy then I suggest you to develop your business skills along with your pizza taste! They wrote BDT 600++ for their medium sized pizza but they took 990 instead because of stuffed crust which is so not worth the money!

Ordered through their online home delivery system at 00:03 p.m. and received the food at 03:05 pm. but they said it would be delivered by 00:30 p.m. When I called at 00:30 p.m. to ask about the order they informed me that the ordered had not been placed due to a server error, although I had already talked to them before that and they informed nothing then. When we asked for a discount for the horrible service, they said they would give a discount but the delivery man asked for the whole bill. Pizza was ok but will not be ordering again...at least not online. If you cannot keep up your own servers then you should make deals with third-parties like hungrynaki.

First of all if i start talking about the pizza, it was almost tasteless. I ordered one of their large pizzas, and due to a running offer i got one for free. If they cannot provide good quality pizza in an offer, why do they even give such offers! Again, totally disappointed with their slow service. The waiters are not even trained well. Whenever i wanted a tissue or a drinks, they started calling each other to serve me taking 5/00 mins just to come and talk. Never going back.

Poor service. Average quality of pizza, at best they can manage. Unbelievably slow. Ordered three items and it took them one and half hour to serve it. Don't even place tissue on the table: went there with 3 people. And they place just four tissues under forks and knives. and that's it. You want more tissue, they'll listen and will be gone. Ultimately, you have to fetch them yourselves. Paid for about 4k Tk, all of which feels completely wasted on nothing.

Mirpur Branch: Ill behaved waiters! Dont know the simple COURTESY to behave with customers. Whenever i complained it, the manager tried to cover it. LOL. Please take necesary trainings for all your staffs. Never recommend it. You can be one of those customers facing disrespect.

Worst pizza ever tasted. Ordered pizza with sausage crust. They gave it wrong. When complained, they replied saying they got technical issues (which was a very lame excuse). They used local cheese instead of Mozzarella. Made a chaos during providing the bill too. Overall I would have given a negative 5 if there was an option. All I can say is, train your waiters first before starting an outlet.

I went to your Uttara outlet to avail the "FNF Offer" today around 09:00PM. Before going there, i checked your website and decided to order One Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza Large & One Deep Dish Pizza Large. When I was ordering Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza Large, the waiter told me that there is no such Pizza of Pizza Inn named Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza Large. When I told him that I have checked your website, he replied it can't be there. After that when I told him about t...he Deep Dish Pizza, he replied it is not included in the Offer. He also told me "Deep Dish Pizza is very EXPENSIVE. It will cost around TK.0800." Now my questions are: 0. If there is no such Pizza of Pizza Inn named Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza Large, then why you are displaying in your website? 0. If I have checked your website, then I am certain about the prices of the Products. Do you tell your customers that "Sir, this Pizza is expensive. Don't take this one? Later I ordered BBQ Chicken Classic Large & Meaty Max Pizza Large. This is not the first time I am getting this kind of customer service from your Uttara Branch. You simply can't run your business with this kind of unprofessional team. One will not surely pay for getting this kind of shitty service.

I couldn't understand whether it was apple juice or not. Because bad smell was coming from that juice. So i didn't have that one also. Not going to come here anymore. Waste of money!!!!! Another thing, the waiters which are serving don't know which food is available for the day. They have to ask their superior all the time. Isn't it annoying?

Most of the items were below average. Though there are many dishes, most of them don't deserve more than a bite. The advertisement is not all revealing, though it mentions Buy 0 Get 0 on Stan Chart Cards, there are particular specifications of the cards with offer, not all Standard Chartered Cards are liable to get the offer. And most importantly, though the advertisement mentions the Buffet price to be 3540 ( all inclusive), what has not been mentioned is that this excludes all beverages including water which will be charged at an exhorbitant rate plus 06.5% extra VAT and service charge on that. So those who are planning to go to the Street Food Festival, think twice.

I have been with BFC's food since 0004.for me BFC chicken is the best in the town.I have visited almost all the branches in Dhaka and know many outlet managers those who are working for the last 00 years.But it is really sad to say, BFC, Mirpur 00 branch has got some problems. I have been there several times since I have shifted my residence in Mirpur. The staffs are not well mannered. I have shared some of them, incident 0: one... day they have served me wrong drinks, when i objected the waiter said, it is not possible. incident 0: sometime a portion of the total area is blocked, i requested manager, he ignored. last incident: When a half of the sweet corn are eaten i have found some parts of a steel dish washing net inside, I complained they wanted to give another but i said no.The young outlet Manager was in front of me turned around even saying sorry.I was horrified about thinking their cleaning stuff.Hope authority will frequent visit their outlets and will check hygienic food ,cooking stuff and customers feedback's.DROPBOX is the better idea.and managers should be well trained., so that other staffs can perform better.

My first review consisted of 5 stars but today, I am bound to revise my review & mark it with 0 star. I am incredibly annoyed with the quantity & the quality of the food items which they provided from their Dhanmondi branch. I ordered online through pathao food. I ordered their platter, R0, & it seemed to me that I paid 0500+ taka for a mere box of French fries!!! I had the same platter twice, before, but they have seemingly deteriorated the quality & lowered the quantity of ...their food items. Probably, they re-use the oil in which they fry their items. There was a distinct smell of used oil. The fish fingers were unbelievably thin & small. I just could see French fries throughout the box & the calamaries & shrimps were very few in numbers. In Ramadan too, I experienced the same thing. I had enough of Manhattan Fish Market. Never ever going back there or ordering food online from them. They literally have lost a regular customer.

I went to MFM on Saturday around 4:00 pm along with my Family. I ordered 4 dori special and Onion Rings and Mussels. Onion Ring was really bad and dori salad was stale and smell bad. Mussels were ok. We ordered four drinks but even after our meal is completed we did not get the drinks. My kids ordered two Gummy Bear flavour and they did get that either. Kids were extremely disappointed ï¿½

Yesterday's azan was at 6.46 PM. The restaurant had served tang and iced tea beforehand. After the azan, everyone around us had food, except 3 tables. I figured they'd be 4/5 mins late. But nope, we waited there till 7.05 PM and got no food, while there was a table of around 05 people who'd received their second servings by that time. One time, a waiter came to our table with food, we got really excited because we'd been somewhat fasting for an extra 05 minutes, but then the ...waiter went back because that food wasn't for our table; such a tease, innit. At around 7 PM while everyone there was eating their fish and chips and we were sitting with our glass of iced tea, they brought us some really unappetizing, complementary soup. I lost it at that point and asked why they are seating people if they can't make enough food. To which they replied "Amra chai na kono customer mon kharap koruk." Bro you aren't serving people food for iftar, I think that's enough for me to "mon kharap." So then we left the place, as soon as we get on the lift they say "Apnader food chole ashche." As if I'm ever going back. We went to BFC and had super wholesome fried chicken. No ragrets, but f u, The Manhattan FISH MARKET Bangladesh. There was more weird shit before this, of course. I'd asked on Facebook whether or not the restaurant takes reservations, and they'd replied that they don't have any booking system in their outlets. They said that they serve people on a "first come, first serve" basis so it'd be best if we show up at least 45 minutes before iftar. I called the number given on your Facebook page and website again today at around 3 pm to check if you really don't take bookings. The cellphone was switched off. So we went to the Dhanmondi outlet at 5 PM today, and they told us they couldn't seat two people because all seats were booked. I told them that whoever manages their social media doesn't know that they take bookings, and if I show up at 5 at a virtually empty restaurant that serves iftar "first come, first get," then I should get a table. Then they found us a table, lol. They took our order for an iftar platter at around 6 pm. After 05 minutes or so, they came to confirm it, and their receipt had the items "garlic mussels, water" whereas we'd ordered fish and chips and chicken tenders. We told them that they'd taken a completely wrong order for some reason. I mean, I'd understand if they'd thought we ordered grilled fish instead of fried, but mussels???? What??? But then we got no food at all because MUSSELS KHAIBI NA TOH MANHATTAN FISH MARKET AISOS KEN

This was my first visit to MFM and my experience was awful. I ordered chicken mussels calamari and for drinks I ordered sunset by the bay and lemongrass cooler. The drinks were so disgusting that we both could not take the second sip of those. The drinks were smelling like cockroach and cough syrup and the chicken was smelly too. The spice in the mussels was not good at all. The only good thing was the fries. I would not recommend this place for anything. We ordered coleslaw which was not served and thank God for that. We had some issues with the bill as well. They should improve the sincerity to their customers.

Last food experience was horrible! I was craving for chicken cashew nut salad & thus ordered this from them, along with a set menu via Hungrynaki. The cashew nut salad which they provide with their set menu is completely different from that of the individual dish. I haven't, in my whole, tasted such disgusting chicken cashew nut salad. It smells like beguni & pakora. They fry extemely thin & mini slices of chicken,(almost invisible), by covering them up with a huge amount of ...besan & flour which is responsible for this weird smell. There was abnormal thick coating in each of the chicken slices. The cashew nut salad which they provide with the set menu atleast contains capicum slices but the individual dish contains onions & cucumber only! Horrible...horrible experience. My craving was being killed by their food & I literally threw it away. They should & must stop cheating people by coating up their meat pieces with unnecessary amount of besan & flour to make them look bigger. I had the same experience with one of their beef items. The quality of their wrapped prawns has deteriorated too. There is too much of noodles & the prawns are incredibly thin & small. & the dish is too try but previously their wrapped prawns were juicy. I used to order from them a lot via Hungrynaki but the last time made me too disappointed with the quality of their dishes & have decided not to order from them anymore since you get only fried besan & flour.
